author: R Sivaraman
text:
Sources say BJP top leaders are holding talks with Rangasamy

Pattali Makkal Katchi (PMK) and Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) are keen to ally with the ruling the All India N R Congress (AINRC) in the coming Assembly elections in the Union Territory. Sources added the top leaders of these parties have begun talks with AINRC president and Chief Minister N. Rangasamy already.

PMK Puducherry unit secretary Gopi alias Gopalakrishnan claimed that the party has expanded its support base in Tamil Nadu and Puducherry. “The PMK has decided to forge an alliance with a regional party, which is neither a Dravidian, nor a national party. As of now, the cadres have expressed their desire to have an alliance with the AINRC to face the coming elections,” he said.

Following the party leadership consenting to the wishes of cadres, the office bearers of PMK have been told to conduct preparatory talks for forging an alliance with AINRC, said the PMK unit secretary.

Office-bearers of PMK have been told to conduct preparatory talks for the alliance
title: PMK, BJP keen to forge alliance with ruling AINRC
